definition: lit. money will make the Devil turn millstones (idiom)/fig. with money, you can do anything you like
pinyin: you3 qian2 neng2 shi3 gui3 tui1 mo4

definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
surname Neng
can/to be able to/might possibly/ability/(physics) energy
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
grindstone/to grind/to turn round
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Money can move even the gods.

sentences.chinese: 别忘了，有钱能使鬼推磨。

sentences.english: There is a saying that goes, “money makes a mare go.”
sentences.chinese: 俗话说，“有钱能使鬼推磨。”

sentences.english: "Money talks" could not be applied to every situation.
sentences.chinese: “有钱能使鬼推磨”不能适用于所有场合。

sentences.english: Money makes the mare go. You can secure your ends with one hundred pounds.
sentences.chinese: 有钱能使鬼推磨，用一百英镑你就能达到目的。

sentences.english: Money talks, but sometimes it needs an interpreter.
sentences.chinese: 有钱能使鬼推磨，但有时需要一个传话筒。

sentences.english: 'Money talks, and people walk, ' he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，有钱能使鬼推磨，没钱则寸步难行。

sentences.english: Gold is the great magician of earth-it realises our dreams.
sentences.chinese: 有钱能使鬼推磨，钱财能实现我们的梦想。

sentences.english: Money can buy the devil himself.

definition: money is all-powerful/money can move God
money is omnipotent (idiom)/with money, you can do anything/money talks
lit. human beings will die for riches, just as birds will for food (idiom)/fig. man will do anything in his means to become rich
pinyin: ren2 wei4 cai2 si3 , niao3 wei4 shi2 wang2

definition: to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
with money, you can do anything (idiom)/money talks
the notion in society that it's better to get ahead in the world by abandoning one's scruples than to suffer poverty/lit. despising poverty but not prostitution (idiom)
well-off/wealthy
poor and with low expectations/poverty stunts ambition
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: all businessmen are evil (idiom)
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to put money above everything else
lit. public opinion is powerful enough to melt metal (idiom)/fig. public clamor can obscure the actual truth/mass spreading of rumors can confuse right and wrong
Look out for yourself, or heaven and earth will combine to destroy you./Every man for himself, and the Devil take the hindmost.
pinyin: ren2 bu4 wei4 ji3 , tian1 zhu1 di4 mie4

definition: wise saying/words of wisdom
lit. to love money as much as one's own life (idiom)/fig. avaricious/tightfisted
